verses.verse: The word<WH1697> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> from the LORD<WH3068>, saying<WH559>,
Thus speaketh<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, Write<WH3789> thee all the words<WH1697> that I have spoken<WH1696> unto thee in a book<WH5612>.

For, lo, the days<WH3117> come<WH935>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, that I will bring again<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> and Judah<WH3063>, saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>: and I will cause them to return<WH7725> to the land<WH776> that I gave<WH5414> to their fathers<WH1>, and they shall possess<WH3423> it.
And these are the words<WH1697> that the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> concerning Israel<WH3478> and concerning Judah<WH3063>.
For thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; We have heard<WH8085> a voice<WH6963> of trembling<WH2731>, of fear<WH6343>, and not of peace<WH7965>. of fear: or, there is fear, and not peace

Ask<WH7592> ye now, and see<WH7200> whether a man<WH2145> doth travail with child<WH3205>? wherefore do I see<WH7200> every man<WH1397> with his hands<WH3027> on his loins<WH2504>, as a woman in travail<WH3205>, and all faces<WH6440> are turned<WH2015> into paleness<WH3420>? a man: Heb. a male
Alas<WH1945>! for that day<WH3117> is great<WH1419>, so that<WH369> none is like it: it is even the time<WH6256> of Jacob's<WH3290> trouble<WH6869>; but he shall be saved<WH3467> out of it.

For it shall come to pass in that day<WH3117>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, that I will break<WH7665> his yoke<WH5923> from off thy neck<WH6677>, and will burst<WH5423> thy bonds<WH4147>, and strangers<WH2114> shall no more serve<WH5647> themselves of him:
But they shall serve<WH5647> the LORD<WH3068> their God<WH430>, and David<WH1732> their king<WH4428>, whom I will raise up<WH6965> unto them.

Therefore fear<WH3372> thou not, O my servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>; neither be dismayed<WH2865>, O Israel<WH3478>: for, lo, I will save<WH3467> thee from afar<WH7350>, and thy seed<WH2233> from the land<WH776> of their captivity<WH7628>; and Jacob<WH3290> shall return<WH7725>, and shall be in rest<WH8252>, and be quiet<WH7599>, and none shall make him afraid<WH2729>.

For I am with thee, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, to save<WH3467> thee: though I make<WH6213> a full end<WH3617> of all nations<WH1471> whither I have scattered<WH6327> thee, yet will I not make<WH6213> a full end<WH3617> of thee: but I will correct<WH3256> thee in measure<WH4941>, and will not leave thee altogether<WH5352> unpunished<WH5352>.
For thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, Thy bruise<WH7667> is incurable<WH605>, and thy wound<WH4347> is grievous<WH2470>.
There is none to plead<WH1777> thy cause<WH1779>, that thou mayest be bound up<WH4205>: thou hast no healing<WH8585> medicines<WH7499>. that: Heb. for binding up, or, pressing

All thy lovers<WH157> have forgotten<WH7911> thee; they seek<WH1875> thee not; for I have wounded<WH5221> thee with the wound<WH4347> of an enemy<WH341>, with the chastisement<WH4148> of a cruel one<WH394>, for the multitude<WH7230> of thine iniquity<WH5771>; because thy sins<WH2403> were increased<WH6105>.

Why criest<WH2199> thou for thine affliction<WH7667>? thy sorrow<WH4341> is incurable<WH605> for the multitude<WH7230> of thine iniquity<WH5771>: because thy sins<WH2403> were increased<WH6105>, I have done<WH6213> these things unto thee.

Therefore all they that devour<WH398> thee shall be devoured<WH398>; and all thine adversaries<WH6862>, every one of them, shall go<WH3212> into captivity<WH7628>; and they that spoil<WH7601> <WH8154> thee shall be a spoil<WH4933>, and all that prey<WH962> upon thee will I give<WH5414> for a prey<WH957>.

For I will restore<WH5927> health<WH724> unto thee, and I will heal<WH7495> thee of thy wounds<WH4347>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>; because they called<WH7121> thee an Outcast<WH5080>, saying, This is Zion<WH6726>, whom no man seeketh after<WH1875>.

Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Behold, I will bring again<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of Jacob's<WH3290> tents<WH168>, and have mercy<WH7355> on his dwellingplaces<WH4908>; and the city<WH5892> shall be builded<WH1129> upon her own heap<WH8510>, and the palace<WH759> shall remain<WH3427> after the manner<WH4941> thereof. heap: or, little hill

And out of them shall proceed<WH3318> thanksgiving<WH8426> and the voice<WH6963> of them that make merry<WH7832>: and I will multiply<WH7235> them, and they shall not be few<WH4591>; I will also glorify<WH3513> them, and they shall not be small<WH6819>.
Their children<WH1121> also shall be as aforetime<WH6924>, and their congregation<WH5712> shall be established<WH3559> before<WH6440> me, and I will punish<WH6485> all that oppress<WH3905> them.

And their nobles<WH117> shall be of themselves, and their governor<WH4910> shall proceed<WH3318> from the midst<WH7130> of them; and I will cause him to draw near<WH7126>, and he shall approach<WH5066> unto me: for who is this that engaged<WH6148> his heart<WH3820> to approach<WH5066> unto me? saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>.
And ye shall be my people<WH5971>, and I will be your God<WH430>.

Behold, the whirlwind<WH5591> of the LORD<WH3068> goeth forth<WH3318> with fury<WH2534>, a continuing<WH1641> whirlwind<WH5591>: it shall fall with pain<WH2342> upon the head<WH7218> of the wicked<WH7563>. continuing: Heb. cutting fall: or, remain

The fierce<WH2740> anger<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068> shall not return<WH7725>, until he have done<WH6213> it, and until he have performed<WH6965> the intents<WH4209> of his heart<WH3820>: in the latter<WH319> days<WH3117> ye shall consider<WH995> it.
